tweets.text:
Another day another @EnvAgency failure.

Four out of nine water companies in England are now rated as poor when it comes to pollution, the worst result since 2011.

For how much longer I wonder will @MPGeorgeEustice tolerate the incompetence?

https://t.co/X05iHf0Lxu

New figures show #water company #pollution incidents rose from 1,863 in 2018 to 2,204 in 2019. 

Anglian, Southern, South West & Northumbrian Water all rated poor by @EnvAgency, putting the #25YearEnvironmentPlan & ecological recovery at risk.

https://t.co/WCsN6fStKk https://t.co/bHhT3FoqXm

Thousands of fish will be killed in the double-decker sized cooling tunnels at Hinkley Point C. @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO please make the right decision and make sure an Acoustic Fish Deterrent is installed, as the DCO states. #SaveSevernsFish 

https://t.co/XCDB3kT04r

It‚Äôs not just #sewage that is killing #rivers it‚Äôs poor land management too. This is the Glottenham Stream in the #HighWeald #AONB with a heavy burden of #soil run-off after a moderate amount of rain. @EnvAgencySE @SE_Rivers_Trust @SussexWildlife @highweald https://t.co/TmSH18z4r8

As a little contrast everyday water companies leak 2,954,000,000 litres of water from their underinvested, under repaired, faulty, leaky pipes.

Yep that's 1,078,210,000,000 litres of water per year stolen from our rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/RkJP0KAsoX
Such an out dated approach by @EnvAgency . Water sports are booming, wetsuit sales through the roof. We moved on from Victorian times... https://t.co/4mjVlOBwuB

1/2 @EnvAgencySW @dartmoornpa @ExmoorNP @AliDriverUK  Here are live willow bundles that went into this Exmoor stream (really a ditch at this point) in March '19. https://t.co/8oW8Q8Daia

2/2 @EnvAgencySW @dartmoornpa @ExmoorNP @AliDriverUK  Grown well over the summer, are collecting lots of silt and forcing the ditch sideways.
